title: French Polynesia: Independentists' victory is first step toward a self-determination referendum
description: The pro-independence party came out on top in the second round of territorial elections, with MP Moetai Brotherson expected to be elected president in mid-May.

title: Massive turnout at French Labor Day protests marked by clashes
description: The turnout was significantly higher than Labor Day last year but smaller than the biggest protests seen against the pension reform this year.

title: Yoshua Bengio: 'Today, AI is the Wild West! We need to slow down'
description: The Canadian scientist, a pioneer in artificial neural networks, signed the call for a moratorium on the development of artificial intelligence applications like ChatGPT. He tells Le Monde why he thinks AI development should be slowed down and regulated.

title: 'Succession' season 4: Nero and Caligula in Hollywood
description: 'Succession' final season (6/10). Every week, Le Monde reviews the trials and tribulations of the Roy family and its media empire.

title: Belarusian opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya is fighting for her voice to be heard
description: Exiled in Lithuania, the former presidential candidate is trying to highlight that the fate of Kyiv and the Belarusian democratic forces are intertwined.

title: In Sudan, the Arab myth of counter-revolutionary 'stability' is being shattered
description: Egypt, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, allies in stifling democratic protest in Sudan, are now supporting opposing sides in the 'war of generals' that is ravaging the country.

title: Macron wants to rely on 'silent France' in response to opposition against pension reform
description: In an attempt to marginalize the anger, the French president makes a distinction between the most hostile opponents of the reform and the rest of the nation.

title: France slammed at UN over racism, police violence
description: The criticism voiced during the meeting of the UN Human Rights Council in Geneva came as France braced for up to 1.5 million protesters to fill its streets to mark Labor Day.

title: Wagner chief says Ukraine counterattack could be 'tragedy' for Russia
description: In an interview with pro-Kremlin war correspondent Semyon Pegov, Yevgeny Prigozhin said his mercenary group lacked ammunition.

title: From car trunks to supermarket trolleys: the real street food of Paris
description: Street food might be taking over restaurant menus, but the real thing, sold for a pittance from makeshift facilities, is an underground economy that allows immigrants to survive.

title: French Polynesia: Pro-independence party wins territorial elections
description: According to provisional results, the Tavini party garnered 44.3% of the votes in the second round, inflicting a defeat on the incumbent autonomist government, which is close to Emmanuel Macron's majority.

title: Russian freight train derails after hitting explosive device
description: The governor of the western region of Bryansk, bordering Ukraine, said there were no casualties.

title: Map of the May 1 protests across France
description: Based on reports from authorities, unions, and the regional press, Le Monde is tracking the number of demonstrators marching on Labor Day.

title: JPMorgan to buy First Republic Bank after regulators seize control
description: The San Francisco-based bank had been under heavy pressure after the bankruptcies of regional banks Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank.

title: King Charles: Who's coming to the coronation?
description: World leaders, royals and community heroes will attend the coronation ceremony which is expected to be much shorter than the one staged for Elizabeth in 1953.

title: In French protests, banners by Black Lines graffiti artists are front and center
description: The works of the artists' collective play a central role in the balance of power between the black bloc protesters and the police.

title: French unions back in public favor thanks to pension reform protests
description: On May 1st, the eight main union confederations will march under a common banner – this has not happened since 2009.

title: After pan-bashing, Macron faces Labor Day protests
description: Unions and the opposition are hoping for a mass turnout at the May Day rallies on Monday to let Macron know they continue to oppose his pension reform.

title: Risk of drought continues across France, despite wetter soils in some regions
description: At the end of April, 47 French departments were in a state of vigilance, alert or crisis, a greater number than in 2022 on the same date. 'The situation is worrying,' insisted Environmental Transition Minister Christophe Béchu, during a hydrological monitoring and forecasting committee.

title: Conservative economist Santiago Pena wins Paraguay presidential election
description: Unlike his center-left challenger Efrain Alegre, the former finance minister has said he will preserve diplomatic relations with Taiwan despite demands in the agricultural industry to open the export market to China.

title: Tiffany's majestic opening in New York signs Bernard Arnault's American triumph
description: The French luxury giant is counting on the new New York store for its Tiffany jewelry brand, which was purchased in 2021, to gain a foothold in the United States.
